title: oc6beta5: file sync blocking on files bigger than 10mb: "path .. is not readable"
body:
hi,

cannot since a binary files that are tens of mb in size.

windows client (binary install 1.4.2) with the new oc6beta5 server.
with the same test folder, there was no issues with a 5.0.22 server.

, a folder containing "office 2010" i.e. a few hundred mb of files was was synced to the oc server. (i apologise in advance for the unfortunate choice of test files :-)
the synced works fine except for a handful of files.

the example file is a safari install file, 34mb originally. this also happened with other .exe files greater than 10mb.

client error: file not found

server log:

dec  3 10:28:03 ocloud2 owncloud[9235]: {oc\files\cache\scanner} !!! path 'files/bigfiles/safarisetup.exe-chunking-3662450936-4-0' is not readable !!!


in the cacahe folder on the server, one can see a 10mb chunk:

ls -alh cache/
total 11m
drwxr-xr-x  2 www-data www-data 4.0k dec  3 10:27 .
drwxr-xr-x 11 www-data www-data 4.0k dec  3 10:19 ..
-rw-r--r--  1 www-data www-data  10m dec  4  2013 safarisetup.exe-chunking-3662450936-0

serverver:
- ubuntu 12.04
- encryption and versioning are enabled
- the folder is not shared (hence i don't think this is related to issue #5749).
